summary: Bill Ackman is a billionaire hedge fund manager as CEO of Pershing Square Capital Management . Unlike many of his peers on Wall Street, Ackman primarily keeps a tightly concentrated portfolio . Ackman's position in Amazon complements his existing exposure to Alphabet .  Ackman joins Warren Buffett and Cathie Wood as prominent personalities on Wall Street who have exposure to Amazon, through their respective portfolios at Berkshire Hathaway and ARK Invest . I'll break down some trends in the business and the company's valuation to explain why Amazon has earned the approval of Ackman, Buffett, and Wood .  Amazon is uniquely positioned to stitch its various operating units together through more AI-powered services . By leveraging the power of AI, it can bolster both the consumer and enterprise sides of its business . The first headline-grabbing move was its investment in OpenAI rival Anthropic .  Since Anthropic joined forces with Amazon,AWS revenue has accelerated considerably . Operating income from Amazon's cloud business has almost doubled . Anthropic also agreed to use Amazon's in-house Trainium and Inferentia chipsets . Amazon has enjoyed a bit of a roller coaster ride so far this year .  Square's position in Amazon was not included in the company's form 13F filing for the first quarter (ended March 31) If you had bought the dip in Amazon when Ackman did, you would have paid around 27 times forward earnings . Among the 70 analysts who cover the stock, 66 rate it as either a buy or strong buy . This week's top stories highlight the intersection of the old guard and new school areas of finance with this recap compiled by The Fly . On Thursday, Coinbase(COIN) announced a partnership with Shopify .  The Coinbase One Card will offer up to 4%bitcoinback on every purchase, offered by Coinbase and Cardless, and issued by First Electronic Bank . The company also announced Thursday that it will be launching a Coinbase Business financial service .  BofA raised the firm’s price target on Coinbaseto $259 from $216 and kept a Neutral rating on the shares . The firm thinks that regulatory clarity will be achieved over the near-term, which would broaden crypto participation .  William Blair initiated coverage of Coinbasewith an Outperform rating . The firm views the crypto industry as “nascent, rapidly evolving, and poised for durable above-average growth .  Bitcoin Depot acquires assets of Pelicoin, a crypto ATM operator based in New Orleans, Louisiana . The deal will add kiosk locations across Louisiana, Mississippi, Tennessee, Alabama, and Texas . The financial terms of the transaction were not disclosed .  Northland raised the firm’s price target on Bitcoin Depotto $8.50 from $7 and kept an Outperform rating on the shares . The firm views it as “a testament” to management executing on its kiosk acquisition roll-up strategy .  JPMorgan applied a sum-of-the-parts valuation framework, which values miners based on their mining operation, land and power portfolio, and bitcoin holdings . The firm updated bitcoin miner price targets and models to reflect the Q1 results and changes in bitcoin price and the network hashrate .  As of time of writing, bitcoin was roughly flat this week at $104,990 in U.S. dollars . Berkshire Hathaway's financial strength provides a major advantage . Mitsubishi offers diversification and an attractive valuation . Buffett's favorite forever stock of all is probably the easiest choice .  Buffett has nearly doubled the average return of the S&P 500 over six decades . Berkshire has diversification at the top of the list . Buffett's management team remains top-tier . Berkshire's insurance businesses are a cash machine because of their float .  Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the largest cloud provider, and most AI models will run in the cloud . I predict that Amazon will be one of the biggest beneficiaries of this . I believe that we've only seen the tip of the iceberg with artificial intelligence (AI)  Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said last year that he thinks e-commerce will capture a much bigger chunk of the retail market over the next 10 to 20 years . Mitsubishi is one of the handful of stocks Buffett has said that Berkshire will "maintain indefinitely"  Buffett likes Mitsubishi because its business model is somewhat similar to Berkshire Hathaway's . The Japanese company's diversification into industries including energy, materials, food, automobiles, and more should make it a safer stock to own over the long term . Buffett also admires the management team, including their capital allocation strategy . Alibaba and Amazon are both leaning into AI to help drive growth . While Alibaba is more of a turnaround story, Amazon is an efficient growth machine . One stock offers more potential upside, but the other looks very attractive from a risk-reward perspective .  Alibaba's Cloud Intelligence segment revenue increased by 18% year over year last quarter . Its AI-related revenue more than doubled for the seventh consecutive quarter . Alibaba scored a huge win earlier this year whenApple chose its models to power Apple Intelligence in China .  Alibaba's AI efforts are gaining traction despite the U.S. chip export ban . Alibaba's international commerce segment grew revenue by 22% last quarter . Management expects it to turn profitable within the next year . Despite its recent rally, Alibaba still looks incredibly cheap .  Amazon's cloud computing unit, Amazon Web Services, remains its crown jewel . Revenue jumped 17% year over year last quarter to $29.3 billion . Operating income grew even faster, up 23% . Amazon is developing AI-powered robots that can do everything from lifting heavy boxes to spotting damaged goods .  Amazon is using AI to help third-party merchants create stronger, more effective product listings . In Q1, its North American revenue rose 8%, while operating income jumped 16% . Amazon trades at a forward P/E of 34.5 times .  Alibaba faces more risks from geopolitical tensions, tougher domestic competition, and a murky regulatory environment in China . Amazon, meanwhile, is a proven compounder that has shown time and again that it's willing to invest heavily in order to win big . As such, for investors looking for more potential upside, Alibaba is the clear choice .  Netflix could produce monster returns in the coming years . Management raised its full-year revenue guidance to a 36% increase, citing demand for its Artificial Intelligence Platform as a tailwind .  Palantir is the most expensive stock in theS&P 500 by a wide margin . Amazon reported good first-quarter financial results . But management gave cautious guidance for the second quarter .  The wide range reflects uncertainty around how tariffs and the trade war will play out . 60% of Amazon's third-party sellers have exposure to China, and those brands account for a material percentage of ad spending . Amazon has a strong presence in three rapidly growing industries .  Palantir Technologies' computing sales are projected to increase at a 20% annualized pace, according to Grand View Research . That puts Amazon on course for double-digit percentage sales growth annually through the end of the decade . Wall Street estimates Amazon's earnings will increase at an annualized rate of 10% through 2026 . Amazon's strong position in online retail, digital advertising, and cloud computing services could drive double-digit revenue growth through 2030 . A recent survey conducted by Charles Schwab found that Amazon was the third most-purchased stock among retail investors in May . Wall Street anticipates a stronger performance from the retail giant over the next year .  Amazon has a strong position in three growing industries . The company operates the most popular online marketplace worldwide . Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the largest public cloud . The investment thesis is simple: Amazon's strong position should drive double-digit sales growth .  Amazon should become more profitable over time as two tailwinds drive its margins higher . Digital advertising and cloud computing services earn higher margins than retail . Amazon could struggle with tariffs in the near term as one-third of sellers on the marketplace are based in China .  Wall Street estimates Amazon's earnings will increase at 10% annually through 2026 . Amazon topped the consensus estimate by an average of 21% in the last six quarters . Amazon stock must increase 20-fold (1,900%) to turn $5,000 into $100,000 during the next decade .  Amazon is a worthwhile long-term investment at its current price . The company has a strong position in three growing industries and a track record for beating Wall Street's earnings estimates . Amazon stock outperformed the S&P 500 by 40 percentage points over the last three years . Advanced Micro Devices has reported three consecutive quarters of accelerating revenue growth . Amazon has a monster opportunity in robotics that isn't reflected in its current valuation . Amazon is benefiting enormously from its increasing use of robotics in its fulfillment centers .  AMD reported a 36% year-over-year increase in revenue in the first quarter . Company reported its third consecutive quarter of accelerating revenue growth . The MI350 promises 35 times more throughput and performance than the MI300x .  The momentum is catching investors' attention heading into the company's upcoming Advancing AI event . Analysts are expecting it to announce new design wins and potentially new customers for its GPUs . Management noted positive customer feedback and plans for broader deployments for its MI400 chip, which is being launched in 2026 .  Amazon reported a 62% year-over-year increase in earnings in the first quarter . Since it acquired robotics company Kiva Systems in 2012, Amazon has continued to lean into this technology . It has the largest fleet of industrial robots, with over 750,000 across its fulfillment network .  Amazon shares are trading at 35 times 2025 earnings estimates . Robots are only going to get more capable in the coming years, which will increase the number of tasks they can handle in the company's fulfillment centers . This spells massive productivity gains and margin improvement not reflected in the stock's valuation . William Tunstall-Pedoe started pushing the boundaries on what's possible with machines as a 13-year-old schoolboy . He secretly helped create and launch Amazon’s Alexa over a decade ago . His anagram technology was used by author Dan Brown for the Da Vinci Code .  It is 20 years since he started his search and voice recognition company, True Knowledge . Evi Technologies was sold to Amazon in 2012 for a reported £21m . Tunstall-Pedoe charts the company as a 10-year adventure .  Evi pivoted several times as a start-up, from a search engine that answered questions to producing a voice assistant, launching at the same time as Apple’s Siri . Evi was tackling the problem of how to use language to interact with machines, which of course is incredibly topical now .  Unlikely AI is developing technology that combines LLMs with symbolic methods to make AI safer for companies in sectors such as healthcare . 30-strong Cambridge outfit had multiple acquisition offers before working on secret project for Amazon, now known as Alexa, which went to market in late 2014 .  Thus Unlikely AI was born to earn trust and solve complex issues with its deep learning software . Tunstall-Pedoe says LLMs are designed to be accurate and explainability and auditability .  I built a database of millions of facts about the world, where the system could make sense and reason with them . I thought it would be interesting to do an analysis of all the facts that the system knew, and in particular with the goal of finding what the least interesting date in history was — 11 April 1954 . The story went so viral that it got told and retold and it’s had new life ever since .  You can have 100 million users within a couple of months if you create a really successful piece of software, which is kind of almost impossible in almost any other industry . That's what's exciting about it, that potential for big impact if you're developing technology that really hits home .
